sources.title: Thunderbolt (1929) GEORGE BANCROFTüçï FAY WRAYüçï JOSEF VON STERNBERG
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: George Bancroft, Fay Wray, Richard Arlen
Director: Josef von Sternberg
üçïOSCAR NOMINEE BEST ACTORüçï
Step into the shadowy world of Josef von Sternberg's visually stunning gangster thriller! George Bancroft delivers an Oscar-nominated performance as a ruthless gangland kingpin. Richard Arlen is the wrong man in the wrong place, caught in a deadly triangle over the affections of Fay Wray, the radiant starlet best known for King Kong (1933).

This 1929 crime classic is a must-watch for fans of early Hollywood gangster movies, filled with expressionistic cinematography, high-stakes drama, and a hard-boiled prison setting that would later influence the genre. Before Warner Bros. ruled the gangster era, Paramount set the stage with this gripping tale of crime and redemption! Watch now on PizzaFLIX, the home of rare and legendary cinema!

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

Subscribe to PizzaFLIX for more Pre-Code Hollywood crime thrillers, gangster movies, and vintage classics! Don‚Äôt forget to like, comment, and share to keep classic cinema alive!

sources.title: Thunderbolt (1929)
sources.description: A criminal known as Thunderbolt is imprisoned and facing execution. Into the next cell is placed Bob Moran, an innocent man who has been framed and who is in love with Thunderbolt's girl, without knowing of their relationship. Thunderbolt hopes to stave off the execution long enough to kill young Moran for romancing his girl. Watch on RetroFlix.org:¬† https://retroflix.org/thunderbolt-1929/

sources.title: Thunderbolt (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Thunderbolt was director Josef Von Sternberg's first sound film. It was described by a critic at the time as "a musical comedy plot striving to masquerade as drama." While not a commercial success, it led to an Oscar nomination for lead actor George Bancroft, as well as critical praise for the direction.

metadata.Plot: A criminal known as Thunderbolt is imprisoned and facing execution. Into the next cell is placed Bob Moran, an innocent man who has been framed and who is in love with Thunderbolt's girl. Thunderbolt hopes to stave off the execution long enough to kill young Moran for romancing his girl.
metadata.Writer: Jules Furthman, Charles Furthman, Herman J. Mankiewicz
metadata.Actors: George Bancroft, Fay Wray, Richard Arlen
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 2 wins & 1 nomination total
